What is (are) Benign rolandic epilepsy (BRE) ?,"Benign rolandic epilepsy is the most common form of childhood epilepsy.  It is referred to as ""benign"" because most children outgrow the condition by puberty, usually by 14 years of age.  This form of epilepsy is characterized by seizures involving the part of the frontal lobe of the brain called the rolandic area. The seizures
